Course_Name: [SoSe 2024] Digital Design and Fabrication for Timber

Messages.Author: Pelin Asa
Messages.Content: Hello everyone, 1) This week we will have the class back in room A201 in IfA at 9:30. Please bring all your prototypes from the first tasks to the class, they will set up an exhibition at IfA for the end of the semester. As the milling bit was broken last week and we couldn't get a new one yet we won't be able to mill anything with the robot until the final... Therefore, it is more important for you to work on your designs and structural analysis, and we can go over those on Wednesday. Saki will also show how to create animations of your toolpaths so that you can at least have their simulations in your final presentations. 2) Here is the course evaluation link: https://befragung.tu-berlin.de/evasys/online.php?p=1RHEL Please fill in by July 18.  See you on Wednesday, Stefan+Saki+Pelin

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Guest Lecture Thorsten Klaus - Teams Link

Messages.Author: Stefan Neuhäuser
Messages.Content: Dear all, for those who cannot make it to class tomorrow but maybe want to join remote, you can use the following link, the lecture will be via MS Teams:  Jetzt an der Besprechung teilnehmen The lecture will be at 10 am. See you tomorrow. Best regards Stefan

Messages.Author: Pelin Asa
Messages.Content: Hello everyone, In the Files folder in the drive, I put some photos from our visit to Kunstgewerbemuseum last week, 3d model of the buildings in the area and some slides to explain some of the dimensions. I tried to model some of the dimensions and height differences in the KGM_small file (only showing the surrounding buildings) but let me know if it is unclear.

Discussions.Discussion_Name: What to wear for the class tomorrow

Messages.Author: Sakiko Noda
Messages.Content: Dear all, I am writing to you to inform you about what to wear tomorrow. - Sturdy, closed, non-slip shoes (Safety shoes would be the best, if possible) (No flipflops!) - Suitable clothing, the fabric of which does not pose an increased risk in the event of a fire - Long hair should be tied back. If you have any questions, please let us know. See you tomorrow! Best regards, Saki

Messages.Author: Pelin Asa
Messages.Content: Hi everyone, Exhibition and a demonstrator at Kunstgewerbemuseum next semester is (99%) approved! We can have a visit on June 12 after the class at 12:30, can you let us know in the survey on the course page if you want to join so that we can inform them: https://isis.tu-berlin.de/mod/choice/view.php?id=1838540 P.S. I'm not sure if they will just give us access, otherwise student ticket is 5€.

Messages.Author: Pelin Asa
Messages.Content: 1) Meeting point next Wednesday at 9:30 Gustav-Meyer-Allee 25 13355, in front of Building 15 (next to the bear):    2) Assignments per group (in order of presentations):  Group 1 (Dhruv, Lu, Joe): design possibilities merging the ideas from two tasks Group 2 (Simone, Yin, Youssef): Finish fabrication of Task 1 Group 3 (Kaja, Hazem, Takumi): Finish fabrication of Task 2+at least one more of the versatile block Group 4 (Bridget, Joel, Aleks): Take out keywords/ concepts from the selected projects in the presentation, how would you apply them in a design  Bring all your models again next week, we will take photos of them for documentation.

Messages.Author: Pelin Asa
Messages.Content: Hi everyone, We wanted to inform you that you can now sign up for examination for the course on Moses until May 28. You can email TEK secretary Kerstin Eckstein if you have questions on this.  We will see each other on Wednesday May 8.  Best,

Messages.Author: Pelin Asa
Messages.Content: FYI, this is due tomorrow and module number is 60348 (Bauliche Realisierung im internationalen Kontext).

Messages.Author: Pelin Asa
Messages.Content: Hello all, As we mentioned today, on Monday we can have short online meetings with you to go over your questions or slides for the midterm.  Sign up here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1e_cuKuHzsD4b254VJD6gPkOESVEXByOH0sTUrBH-1bE/edit?usp=sharing (~5 min presentation+10 min discussion per group) Video call link: https://meet.google.com/wub-xutd-mkn

Messages.Author: Sakiko Noda
Messages.Content: Dear all,  I hope this email finds you well. I am writing this email to inform you about the class next week.  - What to bring? Fabricated pieces from at least one of the Task1 or Task2 and a design/fabrication proposal for the other task. (Ideally, if possible, fabricated version of both)  - Where to upload the presentation materials? https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1eaMKv0aK43RtHm9luu7Gd2vTFIpcaT9n?usp=sharing (We made a new folder where you can upload your assignments. Please visit each folder for the tasks, create a group folder, and upload both Rhino/GH data and presentation slides.) (For Task1 I just moved the uploaded files to the new folder. Please make a group folder and put the files there!!)  Thank you and have a nice weekend!  Respectfully, Saki

Messages.Author: Pelin Asa
Messages.Content: The training will be at 9:00 tomorrow (Friday 17 May) at that workshop in the underground level we visited.

Messages.Author: Sakiko Noda
Messages.Content: Dear all,  I am writing this email to inform you about what to bring for tomorrow. (* As I mentioned previously, the class is in person! )  If you were able to start woodworking, you should bring your physical models. If not, it is also fine to show your 3D models on Rhino. Since Pelin and Stefan will join us online, I suggest that you take pictures or screenshots of your models and put them onto your presentation slides. It would be helpful if you can upload your presentation materials to the drive (the folder "Task1").  If you have questions, please feel free to ask!  Respectfully, Saki

Messages.Author: Pelin Asa
Messages.Content: Hello all, ———— TL;DR fill the doodle in this link if you need training for the IfA Modell workshop ——— I was finally able to organize some times when Heiko Rehage can offer our class a training for the Modell workshop, for up to 10 people at a time.  You need separate trainings for the Holz and Modell workshops, but for the purposes of this class I think either one is fine. You might have seen on the syllabus that next two weeks we have some assignments planned that'd include woodworking, so it'll be important to have at least someone in your team that can use one of the workshops.   So, let me know in this link when you're able to join if you need the training, as soon as possible, preferably by the end of tomorrow May 7. It takes about 3-3.5 hours.  The times are: Friday May 10 12 pm Monday May 13 13:30 Tuesday May 14 10-14 (I'm aware that having the training next week would not give you enough time to do the exercise for next week, in that case we can focus on the design for both assignments and hopefully it will be enough time for you to build the model for both afterwards.)  If you can't do the selected time you'll have to sign up for another training on Isis yourself.   If you also want to get the training for the Holz workshop I believe you can find those on Isis too or contact Mr. Steinwand. But he does not offer trainings in English.  Finally, I was informed that this week is the excursion week for the studios, so if you won't be on class on Wednesday, keep in mind that you will work in 4 groups of 3 for the next 3 weeks. We'll have the sign up on Wednesday.    Congrats and thanks to everyone who read this far.   See those who are in Berlin on Wednesday!

Messages.Author: Pelin Asa
Messages.Content: Hello, as you know Heiko was unfortunately sick last week when it fit the most and the next best date on doodle, Tuesday morning, is only good for 4 people. He can offer another option this Friday at 9 am, can you quickly let me know if you can do this time or not in this form on Isis by the end of today: https://isis.tu-berlin.de/mod/choice/view.php?id=1832130 If at least half the class can do this date then I will confirm it with him.

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Next week the class is in person

Messages.Author: Sakiko Noda
Messages.Content: Dear all, I hope this email finds you well. I would like to mention that we will have the class next week in person, not online. Thank you and see you next week! :) Best regards, Saki
